place.name: SNAVE
place.gazetteerText: SNAVE, a parish in Romney-Marsh district, Kent; 2¾ miles E of Appledore r. station, and 5 NW of New Romney. Post town, New Romney, under Folkestone. Acres, 1,494. Real property, £3,621. Pop., 97. Houses, 20. The property is much subdivided. The living is annexed to Snargate. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
